item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "They said there was no rest for the wicked. In fact, there was rest neither for the virtuous nor the wicked, nor for guys like Billy, who were uncommitted regarding the whole idea of virtue versus wickedness and who were just trying to do their jobs." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "With blue vinyl-tile floor, pale-green wainscoating, pink walls, a yellow ceiling, and orange-and-white stork-patterned drapes, the expectant fathers' lounge churned with the negative energy of color overload. It would have served well as the nervous-making set for a nightmare about a children's-show host who led a secret life as an ax murderer. The chain-smoking clown didn't improve the ambience." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Now he must deal with the security system, which has recorded everything that he's done. A video camera is mounted over the front door and focused on the cashiers' counter. Edgler Foreman Vess has no desire to see himself on television news. Living with intensity is virtually impossible when one is in prison." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "A short-order cook, just off work, makes easy tracking for lions and worse" -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Alliteration seems to offend people." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Given my heritage and the ordeal of my childhood, I sometimes wonder why I myself am not insane. Maybe I am." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "In these silences something may rise" -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Oh shit, the mummy's after us, let's all walk a little faster" -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Where there is cake, there is hope. And there is always cake." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "The concept of a weary severed hand, exhausted from relentless creeping, made no sense." -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Nope, nothing wrong here." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "There is no confusion like the confusion of a simple mind…" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Bill add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "We're dismal enough without conjuring up ghosts and visions to perplex us." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "After all, there are other worlds than these and that fuckin train rolls through all of them." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Does a machine fall sick with sores and puking?" Well, Eddie thought of saying, there was this bear..." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I don't know what comes next. Mourners please omit flowers, probably, and for all of us. But I don't care." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "No one ever does live happily ever after, but we leave the children to find that out for themselves." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "We spread the time as we can, but in the end the world takes it all back." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Legends grow beards, and twenty-three years is plenty of time to grow a long one." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Do any of us, except in our dreams, truly expect to be reunited with our hearts' deepest loves, even when they leave us only for minutes, and on the most mundane of errands? No, not at all. Each time they go from our sight we in our secret hearts count them as dead." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "There's nothing like stories on a windy night when folks have found a warm place in a cold world." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The stories we hear in our childhood are the ones we remember all our lives." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Stories take a person away. If they're good ones, that is." -- Stephen King

item.title: Bill add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The worst thing about wishes is that sometimes they come true" -- Stephen King
